intro: Rhabdocaulon stenodontum, commonly known as the narrow-toothed rhabdocaulon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
